content.question:
A research scientist is conducting an experiment to determine whether a new chemical process creates less toxic byproduct compared to the current chemical process. The scientist took a random sample of products made with the current chemical process and calculated the sample mean amount of toxic byproduct created. The scientist then took a random sample of products made with the new chemical process and calculated the sample mean amount of toxic byproduct created. The difference in the sample means (current minus new) was <math alttext="2.31" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.31</mn></math> liters of toxic byproduct. A hypothesis test was conducted using the following hypotheses.

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu sub current, end sub, minus mu sub new, end sub, equals 0; and H sub a, colon, mu sub current, end sub, minus mu sub new, end sub, is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"> <mpadded> <mtable columnalign="left"> <mtr> <mtd> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <mo> </mo> <msub> <mi>μ</mi> <mrow> <mi>c</mi> <mi>u</mi> <mi>r</mi> <mi>r</mi> <mi>e</mi> <mi>n</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>-</mo> <msub> <mi>μ</mi> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mi>e</mi> <mi>w</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mtext>a</mtext> </msub> <mo>:</mo> <mo> </mo> <msub> <mi>μ</mi> <mrow> <mi>c</mi> <mi>u</mi> <mi>r</mi> <mi>r</mi> <mi>e</mi> <mi>n</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>-</mo> <msub> <mi>μ</mi> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mi>e</mi> <mi>w</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mpadded> </math>

Assuming the conditions for inference were met, the scientist calculated the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value of the test to be <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>. Which of the following statements is the best interpretation of the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math>-value?

choices.label: The probability that the null hypothesis is true is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.
The probability that the alternative hypothesis is true is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.

The probability of observing a difference in means of <math alttext="2.31" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.31</mn></math> liters of toxic byproduct is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.

If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a difference in means of at least <math alttext="2.31" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.31</mn></math> liters of toxic byproduct is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.

If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a difference in means of at most <math alttext="2.31" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.31</mn></math> liters of toxic byproduct is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.

content.answer: If the null hypothesis is true, the probability of observing a difference in means of at least <math alttext="2.31" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.31</mn></math> liters of toxic byproduct is <math alttext="0.072" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.072</mn></math>.

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
